column4: i'm trying to get postfix installed and working.  won't accept external connections.  netstat shows *:25, nmap local shows 25 open, nmap from remote machine shows 25:filtered.  there is no firewall running, and the machine is NOT behind an ISP that is blocking port 25.  what's going on here?
did you configure postfix to accept external or only internal mail?
well as far as I can tell it's accepting from external, but this IS my first time setting postfix up.
which configuration option controls this?
the setup at the bigining in the command window is where you set that up
red/blue screens
dpkg-reconfigure?  yeah it's set up as "internet site"
are you trying to send mail out to the internet as well?
i'm just trying to set up simple virtual domain mail forwarding.  but i've already tested a local telnet and sent mail out succesfully
tcpdump is not shoing any traffic coming in on port 25.  it's got to be my local ISP filtering outgoing port 25 traffic
which is really annoying.
many other mail providers will block you or not deliver to you since you are not registered as a mail server - hotmail is notorious for this
what exactly do you mean by "registered"?
im assuming you have a domain name registered pointing back to your machine?
yes I do, and reverse DNS matches as well
it can take a day or two to get all the way around the interwebs if you just set up your mx
right, i'm ok with waiting for that, but what currently isn't working is just the telnet in from outside... if that's just my local ISP, then i may not actually have any problems
very well could be
you usually have to go into master.cf and check the first smtp line - usually allows unless you put 127: infront
pdbogen, thanks a lot guys

no problem... pretty much works out of the box but there are many cool things you can do - in the end i just hosted my mail with google because of the occasional mail block :( if only anyone could put up a mail server

yeah no kidding.  i use google apps to for most things.  I just wanted an easy alternative for clients that just want a single email address at their domain, rather than having to set up an entire google apps account for that
